page.title: 10SHEEPSCOMBE CRICKET CLUB
page.content: Sheepscombe Cricket Club plays high on a hill. It is quite popular. The cricketers are local, but few live in Sheepscombe.The ypungest player is 14and some men play until they are about 50.mostly the team draws but rarely loses.To reach the field you climb a steep path. The pitch is uneven,sloping down to a very grassy boundary.The wooden pavilion looks down on the pitch. If you hit the ball uphillprobably you would not score 4 runs. If you hit the ball downhill it is easier to get a 4. One fielder is so low down the bank he cannot see the wicket so he might not see the ball coming until it is too late. If you hit the ball into the grass you may never find it. The pitch faces South and looks on to a beautiful view of Sheepscombe and beyond that Painswick.
